title.narrative: Promoting the Progressive Development of International Environmental Law

description.narrative: The objective of the project is to contribute to the progressive development of an adequate legal framework on the environment focusing on selected thematic areas and issues identified by the Montevideo Programme for the Development and Periodic Review of Environmental Law (Montevideo Programme), through a comprehensive review of the Programme itself and the identification of legal and policy options in selected areas of environmental law. The project is of strategic importance because it provides a framework for coordinating the implementation of the Montevideo Programme within UNEP and identifies/strengthens linkages with existing and related projects across UNEP’s Subprogrammes.An adequate international legal framework in the field of the environment is an essential foundation for enabling the international community to address environmental issues. The continuous development of international environmental law is therefore at the core of UNEP’s work. The fourth Montevideo Programme is the current ten-year strategy for the Development and Periodic Review of Environmental Law, which guides not only UNEP’s efforts but is also a framework for reference for the international community as a whole. The project covers the conducting of the mid-term review of the status of implementation of the current Montevideo Programme (component 1). This review will also feed into and provide direction to the project’s second component which involves advancing selected thematic areas identified by the Montevideo Programme as being in need of further analysis and development. The goal under this second component is to provide the international community and in particular governments with relevant knowledge and a conceptual framework to effectively tackle these areas through legal and institutional measures. The diagram on page 12 positions this project in the context of UNEP’s wider work on environmental law.
